Cardiopulmonary exercise testing (CPET)

Cardiopulmonary exercise testing (CPET) is used to identify high-risk patients undergoing surgery. Thresholds: VO2 max <15 mlO2/kg/min or anaerobic threshold <11 mlO2 /kg/min predict high risk. A metabolic equivalent (met) is a given patientâ€™s metabolic rate at rest. It usually equates to 3.5 mlO2/kg/min. xxx ref
